utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Ashley? I mean, shouldn’t I tell him?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Darling, in matters of the heart it’s best not to overthink things.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s your advice, Mother? With your track record? What chasm of doom has she led you to with her tips on romance?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: As it happens, we were discussing secret admirer etiquette.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have a secret admirer?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I always thought it was silly but now I’m kind of intrigued.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And there is no need to tell Ashley.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How exactly does a secret admirer express his … admiration?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He left a note in my locker. ‘As you walk down the hall, a shard of sunlight glanced off your rope of flaxen hair and set it aglow. And I was enchanted.’

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, that’s so poetic.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I figure the rope of flaxen hair is my French braid, which I only wore after gym glass, which means he saw me in the hall on the first floor between fourth and fifth period.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Narrowing down the suspects.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? You can’t do that. No, you … no, that’ll ruin the secret. No, it’s like a mystery novel. You don’t just go to the last page, do you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You do? Well, you shouldn’t. It’s not … you can’t… the joy doesn’t come in knowing who did it. The joy comes in the journey. In allowing the ending to blossom, like some magnificent Himalayan blue poppy –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay, okay. I’ll let him stay secret.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mark my words. You’ll thank me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: So our victim is Linda Russo. She’s a customer relations worker at a cable company.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe someone was unsatisfied with their service.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s what I was thinking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were? Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sanitation workers found her body under a couple of boxes. She lives two blocks away, over at 24th and 10th. Looks like she was on her way home. Hey, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … it’s nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, she just … looks so peaceful.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: There’s nothing peaceful about what put her here. She was strangled.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With rope?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: So it appears.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, do you have a theory that you would like to share with the class?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s just that … pretty blonde girl, strangled, laid out like she was asleep …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was four years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but he was never caught. This is his MO and she is certainly his type. I researched him for When It Comes To Slaughter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah? Well then, you should know that he killed his victims inside their apartments, not in alleyways. And he posed them in a funeral pose with their hands clasped in front of them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he’s switching up his act.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or this could just be a crime of opportunity where a young woman was murdered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Russo, did your daughter ever talk to you about being followed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you think of anyone that might have wanted to harm her? Any relationship problems?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At the cable company, right? Did she have any issues with anyone there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was his name?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That was quick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 911 has that effect on her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’d you find?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I pulled all the files on all his past murders, just like you asked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I … I believe that was my idea.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. But I only listen when it comes from her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyway, you were saying?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He choked them. Using a three strand twisted quarter inch rope. Based on the fibers embedded in the skin, we know that the rope is green and white nylon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t remember that.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Those details were never made public. Now check this out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The marks are identical.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I found the exact same green and white fibers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It is him. The Triple Killer is back.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: For those of you living in a cave, four years ago the Triple Killer, or 3XK, got his nickname by strangling three women in a week, dropping out of sight for a month, then killing three more. Then he disappeared. I served on the task force that investigated those six murders. An FBI profile is the closest we came to identifying the suspect. Feds say he’s a white male, twenty five to forty five years old.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could be me.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: With a dysfunctional relationship with his mother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still me.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: With a menial, unimportant job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Definitely you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just for that, I base my next book on Esposito.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: He’d learn their habits, then gain access to their apartments by disguising himself as a security guard or a repairman, and then he strangled them. And he posed their bodies as if they were lying in a coffin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you think that is all about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably reenacting some terrible early trauma.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Two final points. The Triple Killer seems to be back after four years. There must be a reason. Maybe he just got out of prison. Or returned to town. He may have altered his MO, but let’s assume that he’s working under the same clock – three murders, one week. Based on Linda Russo’s time of death we’re already into day three. Let’s move on this, people.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. That perv the mom told us about? Linda’s colleagues knew who he was right away. Paul McCardle. He works at her office as a horticultural technician.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, he’s the guy that waters the plants, dusts the fake ficus, or at least he was until he quit yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s interesting timing. I see domestic complaints by the double digits …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Filed by his wife.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ex-wife. They were divorced last month after being married for four years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So in a way, he did just get out of prison.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It gets even better. Linda’s neighbors said they remember a red Sentra parked outside her apartment a few days ago. Same vehicle McCardle has.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s get him in here.

utterance.speaker: MCCARDLE
utterance.content: So what’s this about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Linda Russo. Where were you two nights ago between six and midnight?

utterance.speaker: MCCARDLE
utterance.content: Uh… I was bowling with some buddies at Galaxy Lanes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why did you decide to abandon your career as a horticultural technician?

utterance.speaker: MCCARDLE
utterance.content: I … I just wanted to move on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you used that job to watch Linda, to stalk her, and once she was dead, why stick around?

utterance.speaker: MCCARDLE
utterance.content: That is not true. I’m innocent here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you don’t look innocent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, as a matter of fact, you give new meaning to the phrase ‘sweating a suspect’.

utterance.speaker: MCCARDLE
utterance.content: Okay, yeah, I perspire a lot. Okay? I have a medical condition.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s the least of your problems, Mr. McCardle. Your fixation with Linda Russo was well known, as was your history of violence against women. Your car was seen outside of her apartment and now she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: MCCARDLE
utterance.content: I never touched her. I had a thing for Linda. Okay? I had a thing for Linda and I parked out in front of her place. But I haven’t been anywhere near there in three days, okay? Not since that guy threatened me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What guy?

utterance.speaker: MCCARDLE
utterance.content: I got rousted by some security guy and … and he told me to move on. And it really freaked me out and I haven’t been back there since. I swear. That’s the truth.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Sweaty von Sweats-a-lot? His alibi is holding. The manager of Galaxy Lanes has him throwing gutter balls from five until close.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the security guard?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan checked into that. Turns out, there’s only one building on Linda’s block that uses guards. According to the security company, no incident report was ever filed against McCardle or his vehicle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So McCardle was lying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe not. You know, in the past, the Triple Killer posed as a security guard. Maybe our guard wasn’t a guard after all. Maybe he was the Triple Killer moving McCardle off of his turf.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Well, whoever he is, he’s sticking to his schedule.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We have a second victim.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Her name’s Kim Foster. Twenty eight. An interior designer. Same rope marks on her neck, same everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did she die?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Uh, based on liver temp, I’d say sometime last night. Probably early evening.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Neighbors saw a gas repairman leave at seven forty-five.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No doorman on the building, so Triple Killer calls Kim Foster on the intercom, says he wants to check a gas leak, she buzzes him in?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me check the incoming caller IDs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t get it. Why did he return to the old MO?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nostalgia.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He killed Linda Russo in an alley. She didn’t have a doorman either. Why didn’t he just kill her in her apartment like all the others?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe she was special somehow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vic’s last incoming call was at seven thirty-five from the front door. She must have let him in and boom, he just overpowered her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe it wasn’t that easy. Look at those throw pillows.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s wrong with them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, Kim Foster’s an interior designer. These pillows have been arranged with a barbarian-like gracelessness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like a man would do it. So she put up a fight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Struggled right here on the couch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then he reset the pillows to cover it up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s out of practice, so he’s not so neat …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Found a penny.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Under the circumstances, is this still lucky?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait … I think I found something, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vince. Think it belonged to the killer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe it’s been here for weeks. I’m going to have to get CSU to process this area.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sir? A Mr. Townsend wants a word.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Bring him in.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Cal. Good to see you. How’s Marie?

utterance.speaker: CAL TOWNSEND
utterance.content: Uh… she’s okay. We’re split up now.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I’m sorry to hear that.

utterance.speaker: TOWNSEND
utterance.content: Um… reporters. They keep coming to my door and asking how I feel about… the man who killed my daughter might be on the loose again, and you know… After Sarah died, and all through the investigation, you were always straight with me and I just need to know, you know? I mean, what they’re saying … is it true? I mean, is he back?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Yes. Cal, we’ve got leads. We’ve got good leads. We’re doing all we can to chase him down. If we make an arrest, you’ll be the first to know. I promise you.

utterance.speaker: TOWNSEND
utterance.content: Sarah would have been twenty nine next week. Don’t let him do this to another family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. There’s no news from CSU on the nametag. Not that I was expecting any.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Makes you wonder why he didn’t pull that whole gas leak routine on Linda Russo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know why. The answer’s in here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A transcript?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From four years ago. I took a look at calls made to the Triple Killer tip line and this one stood out for me. It’s from May 21st, 2006, which was a week after the sixth murder. A woman called and left a message, but she was too afraid to leave her name. But she did mention that she lived at 24th and 10th.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Same corner as Linda Russo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was riding an elevator with a cable repairman who so creeped her out that she got off floor early just to get away from him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but cable guy and creepy? That’s a job requirement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except he wasn’t a cable guy. She said he wasn’t carrying the right tools.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And working for a cable company, Linda Russo would know that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why I took a look at Linda Russo’s phone records from four years ago. She’s the one that made the call to that tip line.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Linda Russo was special.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When she got off a floor early he knew that she made him, so he dropped out of sight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which also explains why he attacked her outside. He knew there was no way she would let him into her apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Linda Russo saw his face and he came back four years later. That’s a special kind of ruthlessness.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. CSU just got a partial on that nametag. We got a match.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The man that we’re looking for is Marcus Gates. Forty two, six foot tall, one hundred and eighty pounds, with light brown hair. He also has a snake tattoo running down his left arm. A print match ties him to Kim Foster’s murder. Now a prison psych evaluation calls Gates a brutal, highly intelligent sociopath. He’s done time for manslaughter and attempted murder. His last conviction was for breaking a bottle over a man’s head, almost killing him, for which Gates served four years in Sing Sing. He just got out last month. No known address, no family. His mother died when he was four years old and he was placed in a series of foster homes since then, so he will not be easy to find.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Listen, four years ago, this guy took the lives of six women because we didn’t stop him. We know who the Triple Killer is, we know he’s out there targeting his third victim. Let’s get him before he gets her.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Must be quite a case if it’s keeping you out this late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you know. Someone died, someone else did it. Secret admirer?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Figure out who it was yet?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I took your advice and decided it’s better not knowing. And he left another note in my locker. He said if I liked the rose I should show him by wearing it at school tomorrow. Isn’t that sweet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well … is that a good idea? What would your boyfriend Ashley think?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I get a feeling that it’s not Ashley who has a problem.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m … just not sure it’s smart to go wearing a flower when you don’t know who it’s from. Your school isn’t exactly Fort Knox, all right? Anyone could have put that note in your locker. Your secret admirer could be some … pervert watching you from afar with high powered binoculars.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m going to bed now. Good night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Night. Could you lock your windows for me, please?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please? I’m going to check, make sure they’re locked.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, I had it all set up. It was in this pile, over there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re messing up my system.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey guys. Any news on Gates?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: My system is efficient.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And dumb.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I already went through this with you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s on this stack.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s part of my system!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Your system is dumb.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, nothing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. We tracked down an uncle in Jersey but he hasn’t seen Gates in twenty years, so I’m on the phone with Sing Sing to chase down prison associates.

utterance.speaker: PRISON OFFICER
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, you still there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, I’m still here. Okay. And is he still doing time? First time drug offender. Got it, thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jelly Tyson?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Jerry, Castle. When Gates got released he gave all his stuff to Jerry Tyson, a fellow inmate. So if the two of them were friends, Jerry might be able to tell us where we can find Gates.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now it’s Jerry.

utterance.speaker: JERRY TYSON
utterance.content: I have three months left in this hellhole. All I want to do is do my time, get out, and go see my girl. And it’s never going to happen if Gates gets wind that I talked to cops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He won’t.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: You don’t know that! He’s got reach in here. He’ll have me taken out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here’s the deal, Jerry. Whether you talk to us or not, I’m willing to sit here all day. So it’s going to look like you were spilling your guts to us.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: All right, but I want to be back in my cell in two minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fair enough. Were the two of you friends?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: I guess. Whatever that means in here. I work in the kitchen. I snuck him food so he could make pruno.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And in return he agreed to protect you?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: And now he’s gone and I’m in here going it alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Every con I’ve ever known dreams of what he’ll do and where he’ll go once he gets out. Gates ever talk to you about that?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: I remember him talking about some strip clubs and … um… there’s a place he liked to go drinking. Um … in the meat packing district.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was it called?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Hog something. Something about Hog.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I did some recon. He’s at the bar, nursing a beer.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: How many are in there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Five total. Gates, the bartender, waitress, and two drunks.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: He may be armed. We’ll take him quick, don’t give him a chance to get any hostages.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s him! Let me see your hands!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah man! Put your hands in the air, and why don’t you get on your knees while you’re at it?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Wow. Brought out the old guy, huh? Can only mean one thing. You want me in a bad way, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Hey, don’t forget to read me my rights. Be a shame to get turned loose on a technicality.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cold, implacable … the Triple Killer remains at ease, calm in the lair of his enemy with a resting heart rate of fifty. Set to match wits with his interrogators. I … just wanted to bring a literary flair to the moment … you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The bartender told us where Gates lives. He’s had to put him in a cab on more than one occasion. Ryan’s got a warrant and he’s searching his place right now.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We can’t count on circumstantial evidence to carry this case. We’ve got to get this guy to run his mouth. Only hard evidence we have on him is Kim Foster’s murder. Pin him down on where he was when she died.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Castle. Not this time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Gates, I’m Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Not my type. But … I would make an exception.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know a Kim Foster?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Doesn’t ring a bell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have you ever seen this woman before?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mmm… she has nice hair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have you or haven’t you seen her?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Uh… New York City is a big place. I could have passed her on the street, I guess.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m actually talking about a more intimate interaction. Have you ever been in her apartment?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ve been to a lot of apartments.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This building is at 35th and 8th. She lived in 301. Were you ever in that particular unit?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, perhaps you can explain to me how we found this nametag with your fingerprint on it lying next to her body.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, I can.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can’t wait to hear this.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I work at the Empire Prop House.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And they rent props for movies and TV shows.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know what a prop house is.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So that’s my job. I stock props. Tons of nametags, just like this one. I bet I’ve touched a hundred of them.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Run that down, see if he’s for real.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no record of you having this job.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: They pay me under the table. Oh. Maybe you can get me for tax evasion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This prop house where you say you work, do they have uniforms there?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like gas company uniforms?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Any kind of uniform you can think of, they’ve got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And have you ever taken any of these uniforms home? Do you have any in your possession?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Are you guys searching my place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. So if there are any uniforms there you may as well tell me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Wow. I’m going to want to see the search warrant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What for?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It’s my legal right. And I’m done talking ‘til you show it to me. So you better get with affirmative action back there and come up with a new game plan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He wants to see the search warrant to get a peek at our cards.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How is that giving him a peek?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: The warrant lists ropes, uniforms, and other personal effects belonging to Kim Foster, Linda Russo, and the other six Triple Killer victims. By looking at the warrant he can gauge where we are in our investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not giving him a peek, that’s showing him our whole hand. He’ll know we think he’s the Triple Killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He already knows.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Empire Prop confirmed that Gates works in their warehouse and had access to those tags. He clocked out at seven oh-two the night of Kim Foster’s murder. Now, Empire is in Lincoln Square, which means that he had enough time to get to her apartment and push the intercom button by seven thirty-five.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Show him the warrant. Odds are he will lawyer up, but try to stop him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’s she supposed to do that?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I don’t think she can.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Turns out you got a lot more on your mind than just Kim Foster. I see the names of seven other women in here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ryan.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Tell me you’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not so far. No rope, no uniform … nothing that ties him to any of the victims.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Keep looking.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Thing is, this nametag is probable cause for bringing me in. But I’ve explained the fingerprint and by now I’m sure you’ve checked out my story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we’re still verifying that.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I know how this works. You do not have probable cause to hold me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that right? Can we hold him?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Only in the movies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he can just walk out of here?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Unless she catches him in a lie and gives us cause to keep him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I want to leave now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. You can do that. The second you lawyer up and leave, you become the focus of a major investigation. It will disrupt your life in ways you can’t even imagine.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’m already the focus.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well you don’t have to be. Look, the truth is we don’t have any evidence to connect you to those murders. It all boils down to Kim Foster. Even if your fingerprints got on this nametag by accident, with your record you still looks like a suspect to us. So Kim Foster’s a problem for you. But you can get that problem out of your way. You said you’ve never been to her apartment. Where were you at seven thirty-five last night?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What’s in that for me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If your alibi checks out, we move on. We go after the real killer.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I left work at seven, I walked home, like I always do. I got home maybe seven thirty and I stayed in all night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you’re sure about that?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is off a security camera across from Gates’ apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, this is it. This will prove that he was lying. At seven thirty-five he was on his way to Kim Foster’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, woah, woah. Stop, stop, there.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: That’s him. Seven thirty-one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, that can’t be.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It is. Look. Same sideburns and there’s the snake tattoo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, he slipped out the back and went to Kim’s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How would he get to 101st to Midtown and change clothes in … four minutes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but he did it. Can we enhance this video?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You can enhance it all you want but it doesn’t change the facts. We gotta cut him loose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I just –

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I don’t like this any more than you, Detective. But he alibis out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it looks like we had it all wrong. You’re free to go.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: With this Triple Killer fella running around, you all better keep your loved ones close. Sure hope you catch him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Put a surveillance detail on him. I don’t want that son of a ***** out of our sight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, don’t you look adorable this morning.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I meet my secret admirer today.

utterance.speaker: CASLTE
utterance.content: Oh, I can just picture the scene. You and your secret admirer agree to meet in the cafeteria. You scan the array of pimply faces; which one is his? Your secret admirer uses the prearranged signal of a double helping of mashed potatoes on his plate. He’s handsome. Charming in an asexual, nonthreatening kind of way.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Nice try. But it will be so much more mysterious. Listen to this. “If you want to meet, I’ll be at Strawberry Fields at five o’clock. I hope you’ll be there, too.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … no, no, no. No, you’re not going.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Before you were practically forcing me to find out who it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not in the park. Not by yourself.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But I’ve been there a million times.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait. The first note you got. Rope of flaxen hair? Rope? Flaxen? Flaxen is blonde.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I’m a redhead. You’re totally overreacting. I’m meeting my secret admirer and that’s all there is to it.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, darling, she’s right. You are being utterly irrational. It’s like when I was doing Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf? and I thought my understudy was trying to poison me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yeah, the daily blood tests I paid for. Wait, she did poison you. The Swiss chocolate she gave you was a laxative.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ahh… it added a certain urgency to my performance. But, the point is, you indulged my paranoia. So therefore, I am going to be in the park, five o’clock, at a discreet distance to make sure that Alexis’ secret admirer is not an axe murderer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me you’ve arrested Gates.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not even close. I mean, I don’t know how, Castle, but he killed Kim Foster. And he’s going to do it again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s been no developments? Usually you call me with news. You called to seek my counsel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wouldn’t say it exactly like that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no. You were hoping I had some wild theory… some sort of penetrating insight that would lead us to a breakthrough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well? Do you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nah, I got nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just need some piece of evidence. I mean, someone that he talked to. Anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if Gates confided in Jerry about the previous murders?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, Jerry’s not going to talk to us. He got beaten up in the prison yard this morning and he thinks that Gates had something to do with it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like Gates is afraid of what Jerry Tyson knows.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Get the hell away from me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, Jerry. We just need a little more information on Marcus Gates.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Don’t you guys get it? I’m a dead man, thanks to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not if we get you out. The DA has agreed to get you an early release and police protection.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Gates knows about my girlfriend, Donna Gallagher. He can get to her, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then we’ll make sure he doesn’t. We’ve gotta move on this, Jerry. Last chance.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll do it. I’ll take the deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We need to know. Did Gates ever talk to you about attacking women?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: There was this one time, he told me about this chick, um … Sarah, down in SoHo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That could be Sarah Townsend.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: He told me about how he busted into her place and things got out of control. But it must have been pretty bad, ‘cause Gates said he was worried that the cops were after him, so he busts a bottle over this guy’s head to get himself locked up, that way he’d be under the radar for awhile.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a good start.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: My name’s Detective Ryan and I’m your new best friend. This motel’s under surveillance. For your own safety you cannot leave or use the phone. Right now, you and I need to go over everything Gates ever said to you, even if it seems stupid or unimportant.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Jerry’s story squares with the facts. Sarah Townsend was Gates’ sixth victim and she lives in SoHo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about assault with a deadly bottle?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: It fits, too. It came a week after Sarah’s death. Looks like Gates sent himself up the river on purpose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s still not enough to arrest him, is it?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: No, but it Jerry has more tidbits like that it may help us get there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. We can’t locate Donna Gallagher and she’s not picking up her cell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, where is Gates now?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: At his apartment. Surveillance says he hasn’t left the building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Contact Donna’s friends and family, find out where she is. I told Jerry we’d keep her safe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Can’t you just arrest this guy? I mean, you know he did these things.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He has an alibi. We can’t put him at the murder scene.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: He used partners sometimes. You know that, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Partner?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We never ran across anything about a partner.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. He said a partner helps him get away with things. Though I get the idea he never used the same partner twice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jerry said Gates used a partner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A partner. That’s why he has an alibi. Tell your guys to arrest Gates. I know how he killed Kim Foster.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gates said he walks home every night at the same time, right? So this traffic cam footage from the day before – wait! There he is, there he is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Gates on the right the night of Kim Foster’s murder. On the left, Gates from a night earlier. What’s wrong with this picture?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT_ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s too short.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So either Gates shrank …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: … or this is his partner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He wore Gates’ clothing. He would have access to wigs and disguises from the prop house. That’s how Gates can be in two places at once.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait … what’s that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … it’s a reflection from … from sweat! From sweat! That’s Sweaty von Sweats-a-lot!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Paul McCardle. That’s why he was watching Linda Russo. He’s the partner. He was working with Gates.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m gonna put an APB out on McCardle.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You better add Marcus Gates to that list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: When officers busted into his place all they found was a rope ladder going down to the rooftop of the building next door. Gates is gone.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Got uniforms searching the area. No sign of Gates.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he’s going after Donna. That way he could punish Jerry, too.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We got any leads on her whereabouts?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito’s talking to her friends right now, but she’s still in the wind.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So is Paul McCardle. His car is gone and his ex-wife has no idea where he is, either. But, I did find out how he and Gates are connected. They were in a foster home together.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So McCardle could be with Gates?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Get photos of McCardle and Gates to airports, bus and train stations.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: One of Donna’s neighbors just told me she’s house sitting at her cousin’s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have an address?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but so does Gates. Some guy dressed as a messenger said he had a delivery for Donna.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get there now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get off her!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like to see you talk your way out of this one.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ll try not to disappoint you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found the same kind of rope in your pocket as was used by the Triple Killer.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Last I checked, man’s allowed to carry rope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think you wanted to get caught, Marcus. There’s nothing left for you out here, but in prison? People fear you. You’re a shot caller and you wanted to be king again. All that’s left for you to do is clear the air of all these murders and be done with it all.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Nice try.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: This guy’s never going to give it up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I need leverage and I don’t have any. There’s no witnesses, there’s no proof that connects him to the murders. The only thing that I’ve got him on is an assault charge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, we just got a hit on McCardle’s APB. He’s at St. Benjamin’s Hospital.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Gates got to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, if I can get McCardle to roll …

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Go!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh … um… if… I…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay Castle, go. Just stay out of his way. And Ryan? Get me something I can break him with.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Excuse me. I’m Detective Ryan. We’d like a word with Mr. McCardle.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: You can’t have one. He just got out of heart surgery.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What for?

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: Uh… congenital valve defect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Would that cause excessive sweating, by any chance?

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: Well, among other more serious symptoms. He’s been in dire need of surgery for over a year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why get it now?

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: He finally came up with the money. It’s kind of a costly procedure.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How costly?

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: About uh … hundred thousand dollars.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And who footed the bill?

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: That’s confidential information.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You spoke to his ex-wife. She didn’t even know he was here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She hated the guy. So who sent the flowers?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: McCardle’s surgery had nothing to do with Gates. In fact, Gates sent him get well flowers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means he cares about his foster brother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s your leverage. You still need us to wait and talk to McCardle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Tell Jerry his girlfriend’s fine and he doesn’t have to worry about Gates anymore.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You keep coming back for more. I look for that in a woman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found Paul. He’s at St. Benjamin’s. We know that he pretended to be you the night of Kim Foster’s murder and I’m going to get him to testify against you.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You don’t know Paul.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then we’ll go another way. I’ll charge him with accessory to murder.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we can. Sing Sing might have been a picnic for you but how long do you think Paul is going to survive in there?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Paul didn’t know what was going on. He only did what I told him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The only way to prove that is by telling me the whole story.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Only if Paul gets immunity. And I want that in writing.

utterance.speaker: CAL
utterance.content: That’s him?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: That’s him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Gates, did you kill Kim Foster?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yes. I killed all of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I want their names.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Linda Russo. Before that, it was Sarah Townsend. Five other women.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Gates confessed to everything. You get to chalk one up for the good guys. Why the long face?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because if this were a book, I still wouldn’t understand the operation.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Valve replacement. It’s no big deal. My dad had one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s is if you don’t have the money. Who paid for it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m guessing Gates did. Maybe he stashed away some money from before prison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but he was out of prison for a month. Why wait ‘til now to do McCardle’s operation?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well … he needed McCardle to help him with Linda Russo and Kim Foster.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Packing up?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Oh, just getting stuff together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All that stuff from prison?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Ah, you accumulate a lot of stuff, you know, even in the slammer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You were right about Gates. He did try to go after Donna. But she’s okay.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: And Gates?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He confessed. It’s all over.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Thank God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aren’t you going to ask what happened? To your girlfriend, Donna. You didn’t ask about her. You just asked about Gates. Doesn’t make any sense, unless …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was supposed to die.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: I … I don’t know what you …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And McCardle didn’t get the money for the surgery until after you got out of prison. He’s removing all evidence he was even there. It was him all along. He’s the real Triple Killer.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Guilty as charged.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Excellent work, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, sir. And I hope you say the same to Castle. Where is he, by the way? I thought that they would be back by now.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Maybe he and Ryan went out for a cold one. After a day like today, that’s what I’m doing. You care to join me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I’d love to.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Let’s hit it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That story about Gates getting arrested; that was your story, wasn’t it? You were afraid you were going to get caught, so you hid in prison.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Too bad you didn’t figure that out sooner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Too bad you didn’t leave sooner. Cops’ll be here any minute.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Looks like Detective Ryan called the precinct just before you got here. There won’t be anyone missing me for awhile. By the time they do, I’ll be long gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You won’t get far. They already know your name, your face.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: I can change those. Done that before. That’s part of the fun of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fun like setting up Gates?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Paul McCardle was the only person in the world that he cared about. Once I learned that, the rest was easy. You never know when you’ll need one of these. Besides, Gates liked prison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You taught Gates everything he needed to know to take the fall for the Triple Killer murders. After that all you had to do was pay for Paul’s surgery and you can walk away scot free. That’s a beautiful plan. Undone by a duffle bag.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Not undone. I’m right here. I’ll relocate, start over. It must eat you alive knowing you came so close to catching me, but this is a winner take all type of game.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, Jerry. Shooting? It’s not your style.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Oh, you really don’t know me at all, do you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, it’s not complicated. You were raised by a single mother. She was blonde. Oh, she was beautiful, but … she never wanted you. When you were what, twelve, I’m guessing, she died suddenly. Let’s say drug overdose. You go into foster care, the bad kind. You have so much hate, so much hate towards your mother for abandoning you that you kill these women to get back at her. But you leave them looking peaceful because as much as you hated your mother, you loved your mother. Am I getting warm?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: You’re drawn to death. You like to be around it because it thrills you. Now where does that come from? Your own suppressed impulses? How close to death do you want to get? Huh?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Don’t say anything you shouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, I just wanted you to know, your conspiracy theories are completely unfounded.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My conspiracy theories?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh huh. Alexis’s secret admirer is Ashley. Her boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that’s great, thanks.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah, and he’s a very charming young man, so anyway, all’s well that ends well. Richard?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Well, I don’t think there’s anything more to say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s clear. He’s gone. I’m fine. Ryan needs an ambulance.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, I don’t.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. What the hell happened here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m so glad that you’re okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s the Triple Killer. He set Gates up to be a copycat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know. I did the math when you and Ryan didn’t come back from talking to Jerry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you know to come here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your mom called. She said you told her that you loved her and she figured something must be terribly wrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I figured she might. Good girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Tell me something, Castle. Why did he let you live?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To punish me. Make me pay for ruining his plan. Now he’s going to kill again, all because I couldn’t stop him. And I feel so …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know the feeling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you do.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
